results.title: Robinson Crusoe
results.creator_credit: Leif Gram, Walter J Hucker and Air Programs International
results.brief_description: Scottish sailor, Alexander Selkirk is believed to be the inspiration behind Daniel Defoe’s famous novel. Intrigued by Selkirk’s tale of being marooned in 1704 on a Pacific island for four and a half years, Defoe called his imaginative account, ‘The Life and strange surprising adventures of Robinson Crusoe’. This adventure story is brought to life through animation that will appeal to children and adults alike.

results.title: Robinson Charley: the story of our island from 1690-1960
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor, John Halas and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: One of a series of animated cartoons about the man-in-the-street character “Charley” created to present information about Government legislation on various subjects to the publc. “Robinson Charley” sketches the economic history of Britain from 1690-1960. “Charley” builds up wealth through trade with other lands until he is hard hit by two wars and has to roll up his sleeves to restore his position.
results.title_for_label: Robinson Charley: the story of our island from 1690-1960

results.title: Robin Klein
results.creator_credit: David Haythornthwaite, Janet Bell and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Storymakers”.
In this video, Robin Klein one of Australia’s most prolific and popular authors, discusses the process of writing a book and the ways she collects ideas. Scenes form “Penny Pollard’s Diary” are interspersed with Robin describing her craft as a writer.

results.title: Robin Hood Junior (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Lord Gilbert is away at the Crusades and the evil Baron has taken over Locksay Castle. Lord Gilbert’s daughter, Marion, flees the castle with the Great Seal of Locksay. The Baron wants it back but he hasn’t counted on the youthful cunning of Robin and the village children. Rated: G

results.title: Robin Hood [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: This animated feature was one of the first films to be made by Disney after Walt’s death in 1967. Adapting the story of Robin Hood, in this take all the protagonists are animals - Robin is a handsome fox (very much in Errol Flynn mode), Little John is a bear and Prince John a lion. When the greedy sheriff taxes the citizens of Nottingham to the point of bankruptcy, Robin Hood, a benevolent outlaw arrives to save them all. Director Wolfgang Reithermann has created a fantastic animal kingdom in which to set the classic tale of the inhabitants of Sherwood Forest. Voices include: Peter Ustinov and Terry-Thomas, Andy Devine, Barbara Luddy, Roger Miller and Monica Evans.

results.title: Robin Campbell: old feller now: memories of a Muruawarri (A)
results.creator_credit: Alec Morgan, Martha Ansara and Goodgabah Productions
results.brief_description: Robin Campbell, an old man of the Murrawarri tribe of the far north west of New South Wales recalls, through dramatic re-enactments by his young relations, how he was taught, as a child, to hunt the emu and make animal tracks, and how he worked as a drover in the 1930’s and 40’s. Narrated by Bill Reid.
results.title_for_label: Robin Campbell: old feller now: memories of a Muruawarri (A)

results.title: Robin
results.creator_credit: Jan Sharp, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Why can’t they be like we were?”.
Because she is overweight, Robin has had problems of acceptance with her peer group. The film explores the ways in which acceptance of group norms can affect relationships with people within and outside the group and the issue of peer group power structures at a school.

results.title: Robert Rooney
results.creator_credit: Robert Rooney, Judi Stack, Bob Weis, National Gallery of Victoria and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Survey (National Gallery of Victoria)”.
Robert Rooney’s art is a personal analysis of his own life, and in examining his own idiosyncratic behaviour he is exploring the routines and obsessions that concern each and every one of us. These routines are perhaps meaningless to some, yet they consume a major part of our everyday life

results.title: Robert Richard Torrens
results.creator_credit: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: An account of the origin and history of the Torrens Title System. Shows Torrens’ work as Registrar-General and Member of Parliament, in the securing of land tenure in South Australia. Insecurity had plagued early settlers in South Australia, until Torrens’ land title reform bill was passed in 1857. Unsatisfactory registered transactions were replaced by a single certificate, one copy being held by the Registrar-General and the other by the owner.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lilias Fraser, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
